column4: when i go to www.whatismyip.com it is giving me i believe my dslam ip, and not a lan ip like 192.168.1.., so i was wondering why is that
also 192.168.x.x is one of 3 private address ranges, these are not allowed and not valid on the public internet
i see, so it's getting the ip from the server im goig through to get to the internet?
that IP is the one your ISP gives you
oh, ok so thats some how a static ip?
im just trying o figure out if someone somehow got that ip, could they scan my local network?
your router will block everything unless you forward ports
dutchie86  how can i check how many server i go through before i get to the internet
you can trace the path between you and a server with traceroute, e.g. traceroute google.com
ok, but how can I tell which servers im going through are form my network,say att, until i get ou into the open?
it will probably be clear from the results
yes it was thanks. i always knew how traceroute worked but never used it ;)
